title: Cycling Plus August issue on sale now! Subscribe and receive a free Lezyne Pocket Drive Mini Pump worth £25
content:
In the August edition of Cycling Plus the team looks at the perennially hard-fought price point of £1000 road bikes and puts four through their paces. There are also first rides of Canyon’s Commuter 7 and the Giant Revolt Advanced 0, and eight of the best short-sleeved summer jerseys are rated.

Cycling Plus examines how a new generation of pro riders are ripping up the rule book, there’s a guide to yoga for cyclists and follow the cider trail of Herefordshire’s orchards in Big Ride.

If you’re considering joining your friends electric, Cycling Plus’s free supplement to ebikes this issue has all you need to know.
Subscribe to Cycling Plus to receive your free gift as well as discounts and more

Bargain hunters

Cycling Plus’s bargain-seeking tester, Simon Withers, takes four well-priced bikes from Ribble, Boardman, Orbea and Planet-X to see which took the crown.

Carbon copy?

With the cycling industry seeing almost weekly price increases, Cycling Plus sent Matthew Loveridge out to see what two grand will buy you in 2021.

Electric dreams

Ebikes are increasing in popularity and the testers at Cycling Plus are big fans of all things electric, from gravel to urban to e-road superbikes. You’ll find a complete guide to buying an ebike in this 36-page supplement.

Young guns

It’s not just the England football team that has youth on its side, professional cycling can also boast a bevy of talented young riders who are re-writing the rule book.
